Package com.atakmap.map.opengl

Class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable<Pending>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.map.opengl.GLAsynchronousMapRenderable<Pending>
  • Type Parameters:
    Pending - The type for the pending data; should be mutable..
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    GLMapRenderable, GLResolvableMapRenderable, GLResolvable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GLAsynchronousLayer, GLHeatMap, GLMosaicMapLayer
    @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="5.3",
               forRemoval=true,
               removeAt="5.6")
public abstract class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable<Pending>
extends java.lang.Object
implements GLMapRenderable, GLResolvableMapRenderable
    Deprecated.
    use GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2 API

    • Field Detail

      • preparedState

        protected GLAsynchronousMapRenderable.ViewState preparedState
        Deprecated.
        The current state. This is the state that the renderable and release lists are currently valid for.

      • targetState

        protected GLAsynchronousMapRenderable.ViewState targetState
        Deprecated.
        The target state. The next invocation of query(ViewState, Object) will gather the data necessary to make the renderable and release lists current with this state.

      • backgroundWorker

        protected GLAsynchronousMapRenderable.WorkerThread backgroundWorker
        Deprecated.
        The background worker thread

      • initialized

        protected boolean initialized
        Deprecated.
        A flag indicating whether or not the renderable is considered initialized. The renderable enters the uninitialized state on construction and following a call to release(). Initialization will occur in the first invocation of draw(GLMapView) following entering the unitialized state, and will be considered initialized until subsequently entering the uninitialized state.

      • servicingRequest

        protected boolean servicingRequest
        Deprecated.
        A flag indicating whether or not the worker thread is currently servicing a request. When true, checkState() will not be invoked during invocations of draw(GLMapView). This member is set to true immediately before query(ViewState, Object) is invoked and remains true until the next subsequent invocation of updateRenderableReleaseLists(Object). The value of the member is guaranteed to be valid while synchronized on this.

      • invalid

        protected boolean invalid
        Deprecated.
        A flag indicating that the underlying data has been externally invalidated. When true, a query/update will occur even if the target and prepared states match. This field is always set to false immediately before the query occurs. The value of this member is only guaranteed to be valid while synchronized on this.

      • queryStateCaptureDelay

        protected long queryStateCaptureDelay
        Deprecated.

      • dirtyRegions

        protected final java.util.Collection<Envelope> dirtyRegions
        Deprecated.

    • Method Detail

      • getRenderList

        protected abstract java.util.Collection<? extends GLMapRenderable> getRenderList()
        Deprecated.
        Returns the Collection containing the renderables associated with the current preparedState.

        This method should only ever be invoked in draw(GLMapView) while holding the lock on this. References to the Collection or any of its elements should not be held outside of that method.

        Returns:

      • resetPendingData

        protected abstract void resetPendingData​(Pending pendingData)
        Deprecated.
        Reset the pending data object. This method is invoked prior to query(ViewState, Object).

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread while synchronized on this.

        Parameters:
        pendingData - The object that will hold the pending data

      • releasePendingData

        protected abstract void releasePendingData​(Pending pendingData)
        Deprecated.
        Release the pending data object. This method is invoked prior to worker thread exiting.

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread in an unsynchronized manner.

        Parameters:
        pendingData - The object holding pending data

      • createPendingData

        protected abstract Pending createPendingData()
        Deprecated.
        Creates the pending data object. This object will store the result of the asynchronous query such that the renderable and release lists can subsequently be constructed via the invocation of updateRenderableReleaseLists(Object).

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread in an unsynchronized manner.

        Returns:
        The object to hold the query result

      • updateRenderableReleaseLists

        protected abstract boolean updateRenderableReleaseLists​(Pending pendingData)
        Deprecated.
        Constructs the renderable and release lists based on the supplied query result.

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread in an unsynchronized manner. It is STRONGLY that this method not be synchronized in a manner that it may block any of the other methods that are synchronized on this as this may serious degrade rendering performance.

        Parameters:
        pendingData - The result of the query
        Returns:
        true if the renderable and release lists were brought into sync with the current targetState, false otherwise. If this method returns true, preparedState will take on the state of targetState and the worker will remain idle until checkState() returns false.

      • query

        protected abstract void query​(GLAsynchronousMapRenderable.ViewState state,
                              Pending result)
        Deprecated.
        Performs a query based on the specified target state. The results of the query will be used to create valid render and release lists via updateRenderableReleaseLists(Object).

        This method will only be invoked on the worker thread and its invocation will not be externally synchronized. Synchronization of the query itself on this is strongly discouraged as doing so will effectively block draw(GLMapView).

        Parameters:
        state - The state to query against
        result - Stores the result of the query. The pending data will subsquently be passed to updateRenderableReleaseLists(Object).

      • newViewStateInstance

        protected GLAsynchronousMapRenderable.ViewState newViewStateInstance()
        Deprecated.
        Creates a new ViewState instance. This method will be invoked to create the values for targetState, preparedState as well as a temporary ViewState that holds a copy of targetState for the worker thread.

        This method may be invoked off of the GL context thread.

        Returns:
        A new ViewState instance.

      • getBackgroundThreadPriority

        protected int getBackgroundThreadPriority()
        Deprecated.
        Returns the priority for the worker thread. Defaults to Thread.NORM_PRIORITY.
        Returns:
        The priority for the worker thread.

        Deprecated.

        Returns:
        The name for the worker thread.

      • isDirty

        protected final boolean isDirty()
        Deprecated.

      • checkState

        protected boolean checkState()
        Deprecated.
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the renderable and release lists should be reconstructed based on the current preparedState and targetState. The default implementation compares the drawVersion of targetState and preparedState and ORs the result with invalid.
        Returns:
        true if the renderable and release lists should be reconstructed, false otherwise.

        Parameters:

      • invalidateNoSync

        protected void invalidateNoSync()
        Deprecated.
        Sets the invalid field to true. This method should only be invoked while synchronized on this.

      • backgroundThreadEntry

        protected void backgroundThreadEntry()
        Deprecated.

      • backgroundThreadExit

        protected void backgroundThreadExit()
        Deprecated.

      • invalidate

        protected final void invalidate()
        Deprecated.
        Sets the invalid field to true. This method may be invoked from any thread.

        Developer Note: For content with high frequency or high volume changes, the synchronization on this method may result in noticeable and possibly significant performance degradation. In such a case, the unsynchronized version, invalidateNoSync() may be preferred and will likely achieve the same effect, given then frequency of invalidation, albeit in a non-thread-safe manner.

      • checkQueryThreadAbort

        protected final boolean checkQueryThreadAbort()
        Deprecated.
        Checks if the current query should be aborted. This method may only be called from the query thread, and, generally, should not be invoked outside of query(ViewState, Object).
        Returns:
        true if the query should be aborted, false otherwise.

      • draw

        public void draw​(GLMapView view)
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable
        Renders the content in the current EGL context for the given view. Initialization of the renderer may occur following instantiation or a prior call to GLMapRenderable.release().

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLMapRenderable
        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLResolvableMapRenderable
        Parameters:
        view - The current view

      • suspend

        public void suspend()
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from interface: GLResolvable
        Resolution is suspended. If #draw(GLMapView) is invoked, any data that has already been loaded should be rendered, however, no new data should be loaded. The rest of the data may continue loading if GLResolvable.resume() is invoked.

        This method does nothing if the current state is not GLResolvable.State.RESOLVING.

        Specified by:
        suspend in interface GLResolvable

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from interface: GLResolvable
        Resolution is resumed. This method may be invoked following a call to GLResolvable.suspend() to resume loading data.

        This method does nothing if the current state is not GLResolvable.State.SUSPENDED.

        Specified by:
        resume in interface GLResolvable
